Evening Graduate and Undergraduate Veteran Students

With a mission to achieve excellence in the education and development of principled leaders, The Citadel adheres to its core values of Honor, Duty, and Respect. Whether you're pursuing a bachelor’s, a master’s or a graduate certificate, The Citadel is the place for you.
Apply to the South Carolina Corps of Cadets

, you stand out from the rest. The Citadel provides the best qualities of a military and disciplined environment to support the development of principled leaders. Academic instruction, plus preparation in character development, military training, and physical fitness prepares cadets to assume leadership roles in whatever path they choose following commencement.

The Citadel Graduate College has an evening program for you, that is in demand in the Lowcountry. Choose from more than

designed for Charleston's working professional. Programs are offered in the evening—and some online—to accommodate the professional student's lifestyle. Apply today to pursue a higher degree of leadership.
Apply to the Evening Undergraduate Studies program
Students who have completed 24 credit hours of undergraduate study at another institution may apply to transfer those credits to The Citadel to
. Classes are offered in the evening and/or online. Scheduling is flexible to accommodate the professional schedule of non-traditional students. Learn tonight, lead tomorrow.
Apply to become a Veteran Day Student

Veterans who have been honorably discharged from one of the armed services may be eligible to enroll at The Citadel as a veteran day student. They must have a full-time active service record of at least 90 consecutive days, not including active duty for training. As veteran day students, you will attend classes with cadets but are not subject to uniform and military requirements. Veteran day students do not live on campus.
Apply to become an Active Duty Day Student

Active duty military students are students who are first accepted into the Marine Enlisted Officer Commissiong Program (MECEP) or the Navy Seaman to Admiral Commissioning Program (STA-21), or another approved education/commissioning program. Active duty students attend classes during the day and participate in ROTC training with cadets.

The Citadel is the only specialized four-year public college in South Carolina and leads South Carolina colleges and universities in its four-year graduation rate. The Citadel is nationally recognized by
and holds national and regional accreditations.

The Citadel gives consideration to all applicants who meet the requirements for admission. The Citadel seeks to enroll well-rounded, mature students whose motivation and educational achievements indicate that they are prepared to do college level work.
